Package javelin.model.item

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.item.Item
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Artifact, Key, Potion, Relic, Ruby, Scroll, TempleKey, Wand
    public abstract class Item
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Represents an item carried by a Combatant. Most often items are consumable. Currently only human players use items. When crafting new items, it takes a day per $1000 for the process to complete. Exceptions are Potions, which always take 1 day.
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getselection

        public static ItemSelection getselection​(Realm r)
        Each Item is assigned a Realm on creation. This determines what type of item each Town can produce.
        Parameters:
        r - Given a realm...
        Returns:
        all Items assigned to that realm.
        See Also:
        Item(String, int, ItemSelection)

                              Combatant c,
                              java.util.ArrayList<Item> bag)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        All items types mapped by realm.

      • getplayeritems

        public static java.util.List<Item> getplayeritems()
        Returns:
        A list of all Items in any Squad, Town trainees and Academy trainees (including subclasses).

      • randomize

        public static java.util.List<Item> randomize​(java.util.Collection<Item> from)
        Parameters:
        from - A sample of items (like ALL or from Tier.ITEMS).
        Returns:
        The same items but with randomized parameters, from cheapest to most expensive (previously shuffled to introduce order randomness for items with exact same price).

      • sell

        public boolean sell()
        Returns:
        true if this item can be currently sold.
